column4: /boot/grub/menu.lst seems to be fine but it just can't mount my Ubuntu partitions
maybe you need to edit your boot line from hd1,1 to hd0,1 or something like that?
it seem to be in order everything is hd0,*
Whats the error message? No partition found or something like that?
Can you give me your boot line please
which is that i have menu.lst open
For example mine says.. root  (hd0,0)
when i did find /boot/grub/stage1 i got root(hd0,1) but menu.lst only has root(hd0,1) linux and root(hd0,0) windows
Did you move your hard discs around or something like that?
no its a laptop, only one disk
ok, thats weird.. Did you do fixmbr in the windows recovery console? Did you say your reinstalled grub right?
didn't use fixmbr
Just so I can completely understand your situation.. it just stopped working or..?
Windows got bad, so i reinstalled a clean copy, following the Recovering GRUB wiki page, gave me the grub menu back again but I can't boot into Ubuntu, it said the partition can't be mounted
Ok, right. Do you have a line in your menu.lst that says... kernel  /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.20-16-generic root= blah blah blah....
... and does it have.. UUID= ... followed by numbers and letters?
its the correct UUID for the device

I found a thread on the forums which is like your situation.. They suggest you boot up the live CD and run "sudo fdisk -l" get the new UUID and edit your menu.lst... here's the thread... http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=477169
when i did "sudo grub" and tab complete root(hd0, it gives me 4 entrys
it works all I had to do is change, root(hd0,2) to root(hd0,1)
Ah! I knew it would be a numbers game
